qas.question: What Roman assembly elected both magistrates and censors?
What profession of people made up the entireity of the Comitia Centuriata?
Would the Comitia Centuriata occasionally be called upon to serve as the highest court of appeal?

answers.text: It also served as the highest court of appeal in certain judicial cases

qas.question: Which elected official had imperium powers?

context: Citizens were organized on the basis of centuries and tribes, which would each gather into their own assemblies. The Comitia Centuriata ("Centuriate Assembly") was the assembly of the <a1_0>centuries<a1_0/> (i.e. soldiers). The president of the <a0_0>Comitia Centuriata<a0_0/> was usually a consul. The centuries would vote, one at a time, until a measure received support from a majority of the centuries. The Comitia Centuriata would elect <a3_0>magistrates<a3_0/> who had imperium powers (consuls and praetors). It also elected censors. Only the Comitia Centuriata could declare war, and ratify the results of a census. <a2_0>It also served as the highest court of appeal in certain judicial cases<a2_0/>.
